required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study of CD19 Targeted CAR-T for Patients With CD19+ Lymphoma and Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Trial of CD19 Targeted ICAR19 T Cells in Patients With CD19+ Leukemia and Lymphoma.

brief_summary.textblock: Immunotherapy offers an extremely precise approach with the potential to eliminate cancer cells specifically. The newly designed CD19 targeted ICAR19 T cells can specifically kill CD19+ tumor cells. ICAR19 CART used the second generation of CART designation. In this study, the participants will receive several doses of autologous ICAR19 T cells and the investigators will determine the safety and therapeutic effects of these cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the safety of ICAR19 CAR-T cells
primary_outcome.description: To assess the adverse events of ICAR19 T cells infusion in patients with CD19+ malignancies

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure the anti-tumor effect of ICAR19 CAR-T cells
secondary_outcome.description: Assess for the therapeutic effects of ICAR 19 CAR-T cells in CD19-expressing leukemia and lymphoma

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival time of ICAR19 T cells in vivo.
secondary_outcome.description: To measure the survival time of ICAR19 CAR-T cells in vivo, extra blood will be drawn from patients receive ICAR19 T cells infusion in the follow-up time

arm_group.description: Immunotherapy offers an extremely precise approach with the potential to eliminate cancer cells specifically. The newly designed CD19 targeted ICAR19 T cells can specifically kill CD19+ tumor cells. ICAR19 CART used the second generation of CART designation. In this study, the participants will receive several doses of autologous ICAR19 CAR-T cells and the investigators will determine the safety and therapeutic effects of these cells.

intervention.description: T cells were isolated from peripheral blood from patients enrolled. T cells were transduced with lentivirus bearing anti-CD19 antibody scFV and the activation signals of second generation CART designation. The CART cells were infused into the patients by IV with an escalating dosage.
